3270009f-c2d8-4656-a560-e8c6b8b0f667.description: Earners of this badge have learned the fundamentals of inclusive language in general, as well as identity-specific history, information, and terminology related to disability, LGBTQ, and race & ethnicity.
3270009f-c2d8-4656-a560-e8c6b8b0f667.name: Inclusive Language Skills

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earner's of this badge attended three 1-hour Inclusive Language webinars: Focus on Disability, Focus on LGBTQ, and Focus on Race & Ethnicity

87bc972b-1dd1-4f12-b8ab-32d5d6a66cf8.description: Being able to recognize our unconscious biases and not act upon them is a key competence area anyone who is concerned with fairness and equity in the workplace. Earners of the Advanced Skills in Unconscious Bias learned the function and dysfunction of biases; learned how to recognize when biased reactions are triggered; learned some of the ways that biases play out in decision-making; and developed strategies for overriding biases in daily life and in decision-making.
87bc972b-1dd1-4f12-b8ab-32d5d6a66cf8.name: Advanced Skills in Unconscious Bias

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge participated in 3 hour-long training sessions.

skills.name: Be Aware Of Unconscious Biases And Techniques Of Avoiding Them

eefc2635-a26a-4cb8-be63-03a604eeebc7.description: Being able to recognize our unconscious biases and not act upon them is a key competence area for managers, supervisors, and anyone else who is concerned with fairness and equity in the workplace. Earners of the Overriding Unconscious Bias Badge a) gained a basic understanding of the neuroscience of bias b) learned some of the ways that biases play out in the workplace c) explored various types of bias, and d) gained strategies to override biases in decision-making.
eefc2635-a26a-4cb8-be63-03a604eeebc7.name: Overriding Unconscious Bias

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earner attended and actively participated in workshop.

skills.name: Be Aware Of Unconscious Biases And Techniques Of Avoiding Them
Greater Self-awareness And Awareness Of Others

e565b26c-231b-4492-bf32-57ca460131e4.description: Earners of the Diversity Advocate badge have completed a semester long highly interactive online course. They gained knowledge, awareness, and communication skills for providing leadership around diversity and inclusion issues; working more effectively with people from different backgrounds; and for making UMSL more welcoming and inclusive for everyone. Participants have demonstrated applied learning of course concepts through implementation and reflection essays.
e565b26c-231b-4492-bf32-57ca460131e4.name: Diversity Advocate

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: To earn the Diversity & Inclusion Foundations Badge, participants must complete the following 8 modules: o Module 1: Creating a Learning Community o Module 2 – Introduction to Diversity o Module 3 – Diversity on Campus Module 4 – Introduction to Unconscious Bias Module 5 – Introduction to Microaggressions Module 6 – Introduction to Privilege Module 7 – Introduction to Cultural Competence Module 8 – Building Blocks for Inclusion

skills.name: Be Aware Of Unconscious Biases And Techniques Of Avoiding Them

ebcc6c82-4b41-41c9-8ed7-7b677332acbc.description: Earners of this badge have learned and practiced three key diversity & inclusion skill sets: a) communication strategies for speaking up against microaggressions and other racist comments, b) critical questions for approaching cross-cultural conflict, and c) inclusive practices for creating more welcoming and inclusive campus and workplace environments.
ebcc6c82-4b41-41c9-8ed7-7b677332acbc.name: Diversity Competence Skills

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge participated in three 1-hour virtual workshops.

53146f3f-aef3-449d-8db0-7d1e735a55b1.description: Earners of this badge have a deepened understanding of the concept of culture and its impact on values, perceptions, and behaviors. They also understand a framework for cultural competence, how it applies to the work environment, and how to develop these important skills.
53146f3f-aef3-449d-8db0-7d1e735a55b1.name: Cultural Sensitivity & Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Participants attended a 1.5 hour interactive workshop.

c9a56cfe-c51e-400f-8b01-d6e879d5fce0.description: Earners of this badge learned to a) recognize microaggressions, b) understand the issue of intent vs. impact, c) avoid making unintentional microaggressions, and d) implement strategies for addressing microaggressions. By building our awareness and skills in dealing with microaggressions, we can work towards a more inclusive learning and working environment for everyone.
c9a56cfe-c51e-400f-8b01-d6e879d5fce0.name: Recognizing and Addressing Microaggressions

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Participants attended a 90-minute, interactive workshop on microaggressions.

skills.name: Greater Self-awareness And Awareness Of Others
Greater Self-awareness And Awareness Of Others

01bc7237-c416-432e-81eb-6c55aca5b9c6.description: Badge earners gained an understanding of how implicit bias impacts the way we perceive and treat others. They learned how biases can be internalized in the form of stereotype threat and imposter syndrome, as well as strategies to overcome them within ourselves and to avoid triggering them in others.
01bc7237-c416-432e-81eb-6c55aca5b9c6.name: Implicit Bias, Stereotype Threat, and Imposter Syndrome Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earner attended and actively participated in workshop.

skills.name: Greater Self-awareness And Awareness Of Others

188fa92f-7ecf-4596-99a5-dba946f3adca.description: Earners of the Active Listening Skills badge gained skills to resolve conflicts more effectively; build trust; and improve both personal and professional relationships. Earners of this badge a) explored the challenges and importance of active listening b) learned the 12 Communication Blockers and when to avoid them c) gained awareness of perceptual filters that may get in the way of understanding what is being said, and d) learned and practiced 3 key active listening skills.
188fa92f-7ecf-4596-99a5-dba946f3adca.name: Active Listening Skills

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners participated in a 1.5 hour interactive workshop.

50bd8113-8f7e-4b20-a52f-b6eecc3468da.description: Earners of the Foundations in Diversity & Inclusion Badge have developed a nuanced understanding of the various meanings of, and the potential impact of, diversity in higher education and the workplace. They can explain the different aspects of UMSL’s inclusive excellence framework. They have developed some strategies for improving workplace relationships, practices, and culture and created an action plan.
50bd8113-8f7e-4b20-a52f-b6eecc3468da.name: Foundations in Diversity & Inclusion

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earner attended and actively participated in workshop.

be6c151d-c181-43f7-af3e-97801c096d6f.description: Earners of this credential 1) learned how to create guidelines and norms for groups of people from different backgrounds to work and learn more effectively together 2) have a nuanced understanding of the meanings of diversity, equity, and inclusion 3) are able to articulate the importance of these concepts for individuals, organizations, and society 4) deepened their understanding of what identity is and why it matters in our workplace relationships.
be6c151d-c181-43f7-af3e-97801c096d6f.name: DEI in the Workplace Level 1

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential completed three online modules, engaged in reflection activities, and participated in online discussions.

Earners of this credential applied their learning from the three modules to write an effective, specific, and well articulated diversity statement for a company/organization, a syllabus, or a job application.

141cd605-a527-4b58-8d20-39e4c5d5dd43.description: Earners of this badge have developed the skills to to support and provide guidance in equitable practices in the recruitment, retention, and promotion of high-quality faculty and staff from diverse backgrounds. Equity Advisors are able to serve a resource for committee work to help ensure that each stage of the process is fair and equitable, as well as intentionally inclusive.
141cd605-a527-4b58-8d20-39e4c5d5dd43.name: UMSL Equity Advisor

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed a 16-hour training focused on the impact of implicit biases, the academic search process, and best practices for fair and equitable search processes.

89f04d2e-d918-43bd-bb40-dba8ae782b5b.description: Earners of this credential learned to recognize three obstacles to inclusion that impact our daily lives , as well as the underlying structures and power dynamic that reinforce inequality and oppression. Specifically, they learned to recognize and mitigate implicit bias in decision-making processes; why microaggressions can have such a negative impact on individuals and organizational cultures; and how the concept of privilege plays out in our daily lives.
89f04d2e-d918-43bd-bb40-dba8ae782b5b.name: DEI in the Workplace Level 2

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential completed three online modules, engaged in reflection activities, and participated in online discussions.
Earners of this badged wrote a self-reflection and practical application essay.

31c56777-ba99-4c45-8cbe-8f22d23194e7.description: Earners of the badge developed a greater awareness of their own culture as well as how culture impacts our perceptions, communication, values, beliefs, and behaviors. They also learned three important areas for creating cultures of inclusion in our workplaces: Inclusive attitudes, inclusive language, and inclusive practices. And finally, they learned strategies and practices for enhancing diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.
31c56777-ba99-4c45-8cbe-8f22d23194e7.name: DEI in the Workplace Level 3

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential completed three online modules, engaged in reflection activities, and participated in online discussions.
Earners developed an action plan for continuing development of cultural competence and inclusiveness skills.

42be5181-121b-477d-8121-f7e94d8a46d9.description: Earners of this credential successfully completed a 6-month online program. Badge earners have developed the capacity to be advocates and leaders around diversity and inclusion issues; work more effectively with people from backgrounds; and make workplaces more welcoming and inclusive for everyone.
42be5181-121b-477d-8121-f7e94d8a46d9.name: Graduate Certificate in Workplace Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners completed 9 online modules including review of material, activities, online discussions, and application assignments.

skills.name: Apply Concepts Of Diversity And Inclusion

7efcf105-9715-4bf4-82ce-40501ef7f4ca.description: Earners of this credential 1) have learned a nuanced understanding of the meanings of diversity, equity, and inclusion and how they have evolved over time 2) are able to articulate the importance of these concepts for individuals, organizations, and society 3) deepened their understanding of what identity is and why it matters in relationships with colleagues and students.
7efcf105-9715-4bf4-82ce-40501ef7f4ca.name: DEI in the Academic Workplace Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential completed three online modules, engaged in reflection activities, and participated in online discussions.

Earners of this credential applied their learning from the three modules to write an effective, specific, and well articulated diversity statement for a their department, syllabus, or a job application.

b46ee6b8-e68e-4a7d-96b0-102525dfdefc.description: Earners of the Diversity & Inclusion Advocate badge have completed a 10 module self-paced online course. They gained knowledge, awareness, and communication skills for providing leadership around diversity and inclusion issues; working more effectively with people from different backgrounds; and for making UMSL more welcoming and inclusive for everyone. Participants have demonstrated applied learning of course concepts through Learning Journals.
b46ee6b8-e68e-4a7d-96b0-102525dfdefc.name: Diversity & Inclusion Champion

badge_template_activities.title: To earn the Diversity & Inclusion Champion Badge, participants must complete 10 online modules that include videos, interactive activities, and learning journals.

skills.name: Be Aware Of Unconscious Biases And Techniques Of Avoiding Them

051211aa-7108-4446-962a-779707e1d892.description: Earners of this badge learned and practiced skills to engage in conversations about challenging, emotionally-laden topics (i.e. race, discrimination, policy, politics, etc.) in the workplace, the classroom, and in interpersonal and community contexts.
051211aa-7108-4446-962a-779707e1d892.name: Constructive Communication Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge participated in three 1.5 hour workshops: 1) Active Listening Concepts, Tools, and Practice 2) Navigating Emotions in Difficult Dialogue 3)  Collaborative and Deliberative Dialogue

bf95ae3c-8e16-45b1-957e-e0359afb5690.description: Earners of this credential successfully completed a 6-month online program. Badge earners have developed the capacity to be advocates and leaders around diversity and inclusion issues; work more effectively with people from backgrounds; and make workplaces more welcoming and inclusive for everyone.
bf95ae3c-8e16-45b1-957e-e0359afb5690.name: Chancellor's Certificate in Workplace Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners completed 9 online modules including review of material, activities, online discussions, application assignments, and a final project.

skills.name: Apply Concepts Of Diversity And Inclusion

00215eea-4b46-4e12-9efe-d8eb29e202ec.description: Earners of the badge have learned and practiced strategies for effectively speaking up and addressing microaggressions and other offensive comments that are hurtful to individuals and contribute to an an unhealthy work environment.
00215eea-4b46-4e12-9efe-d8eb29e202ec.name: Upstander

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge participated in a 90-minute interactive workshop.

9ce9892f-c47b-4be3-ad1f-cc1728cf8564.description: Earners of this badge learned to identify conflict types, causes, and approaches to conflict; practiced conflict communication skills (listening, asserting, effective questions); and explored a process for approaching conflict conversations effectively. A constructive approach to conflict helps foster trust and build resilience in our interpersonal and team relationships.
9ce9892f-c47b-4be3-ad1f-cc1728cf8564.name: Constructive Conflict Skills

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Participants attended multiple workshops where the learned and practiced constructive conflict skills.

c7b5b0c8-097f-42e3-a046-b57075e9d36e.description: Earners of this credential learned to recognize three obstacles to inclusion that impact inclusion on campuses , as well as the underlying structures and power dynamic that reinforce inequality and oppression. Specifically, they learned to recognize and mitigate implicit bias in decision-making processes; why microaggressions can have such a negative impact on individuals and organizational cultures; and how the concept of privilege plays out in our daily lives.
c7b5b0c8-097f-42e3-a046-b57075e9d36e.name: DEI in the Academic Workplace Level 2

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential completed three online modules, engaged in reflection activities, and participated in online discussions.
Earners of this badged wrote a self-reflection and practical application essay.

6cefa66a-09c8-42a5-a8e4-130bed8314e5.description: Earners of this badge participated in three 90-minute workshops focusing on three key communication skills for enhancing inclusion in all of our work and social relationships 1) active listening 2) speaking up, and 3) navigating conflict.
6cefa66a-09c8-42a5-a8e4-130bed8314e5.name: Inclusive Communication Skills

issuer.summary: issued by UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

entity.name: UMSL Office of Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge participated in three 90-minute workshops focusing on three key communication skills for enhancing inclusion in all of our work and social relationships 1) active listening  2) speaking up, and 3)  navigating conflict.

f2d2c12c-77ed-4674-bddd-f20ee7c52c73.description: Earners of the badge learned an Inclusive Excellence Framework and conducted a diversity audit of their department and the campus website; they developed a greater awareness of their own culture as well as how culture impacts our perceptions, communication, values, beliefs, and behaviors. And they explored three important areas for creating campus cultures of inclusion: Inclusive attitudes, inclusive language, and inclusive practices.
f2d2c12c-77ed-4674-bddd-f20ee7c52c73.name: DEI in the Academic Workplace Level 3

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this credential completed three online modules, engaged in reflection activities, and participated in online discussions.
Earners developed an action plan for continuing development of cultural competence and inclusiveness skills.

dcbafa92-33a0-47a9-85bc-1bc8ebb22e21.description: Earners of the Diversity Ambassador Badge have made a deep investment in their own learning about diversity and inclusion by participating in multiple 1.5 hour workshops on topics such as unconscious bias, microaggressions, cultural competence, and active listening skills. Badge earners have also created an action plan for implementing learned concepts, continued learning, and promoting diversity and inclusion professional development to colleagues and friends.
dcbafa92-33a0-47a9-85bc-1bc8ebb22e21.name: Diversity Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in at least four Core Concepts series workshops.
Bring at least two people (who were not already planning to attend) to at least one workshop.
Create an action plan for continued learning and sharing learning with colleagues and community.
Submit "Claim my Badge" application.
